title: script font id and flourish/ornament recommendations
content:
Hi,

Can anyone help ID the script and open face fonts in the michelle/edward, praline and cheddar biscuits images? My apologies for the small images.

Also, does anyone have a list of fonts with fantastic flourishes like those in the attached image? I'm trying to gather a list of the best fonts with the best flourishes and also great ornaments as well.

Thanks so much.

Josh

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219144916im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-6_6738.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219144916im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-2_6045.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219144916im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-3_5486.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219144916im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-4_4916.jpg)
author: jjdewtt

comments.content: The open face font could be [Chevalier](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219144916/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/chevalier/fonts/).
Josh, the script is Burgues Script \> [http://www.sudtipos.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219144916/http:/www.sudtipos.com/ "http://www.sudtipos.com")

Josh  
Btw, could you send me hi-res of that pictures (specially the Pralines and Biscuitt) or let me know what products or brand are them? Best, Ale
i think the open faced font is Academy Engraved. I use that with scripts a lot...it mixes nicely.
